summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 regarding procedural logistics for submitting a pen register application and an NDO (Non-Disclosure Order or similar legal order) renewal related to the Epstein case to magistrate court. It shows ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's death.

events.title: Pen register renewal submission for Maxwell
events.description: A pen register application renewal for a T-Mobile number (917-520-3106) associated with Ghislaine Maxwell was prepared for submission to magistrate court.

events.title: NDO renewal submission for Epstein case
events.description: An NDO (Non-Disclosure Order or similar legal order) renewal for the Epstein case was being prepared and submitted to magistrate court as part of the afternoon batch.

keyFacts: Investigative activity, including a pen register application and an NDO renewal, continued in the Epstein case in April and May 2020, after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
A pen register application targeted a T-Mobile number (917-520-3106) associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating ongoing surveillance efforts.
The correspondence highlights the procedural logistics and internal coordination required to submit legal applications to the magistrate court.
The document references the 'Epstein case' as an active matter requiring order renewals in 2020.
